i will definitely take this now
Cool.. what else is in your top ten favourite movies, 2040?

@Fangular: In weeks before last Xmas I uploaded I  think a majority of my bucket-list (I was damn sure that my time runs out).

Surprisingly (kidding), these movies have been downloaded maybe few dozen times and as always, they lost battle against magnificent movies with Dolph Lundgren or with Jackie Chan and few more prestigious actors.

I am sure that my personal taste is very very different from majority around here, but I would stubbornly continue with the rest of few my favored, beloved and precious ones. 

I do not need clapping audience for that, this matter and choices have been explained right here, in more than thousand words and more than few dozen times and are personal as can get.

In case anybody's interested (I like "lists" in case you couldn't tell!), my favorite movies of all time (and kept me sane through my divorce 13 years ago):

Hopscotch - (Walter Mathau, Glenda Jackson, Sam Waterston) romantic spy comedy
Down Periscope - comedy
Last Of The Mohicans - romantic adventure
Starship Troopers - SciFi, 1st part follows book fairly close
Hackers - hard to classify
Sneakers - hard to classify
Invitation To The Wedding - mild romantic comedy, last movie Ralph Richardson was in
Love Is Forever - romantic biographic thriller
10 Things I Hate About You - modern retelling of Taming Of The Shrew
Robin Hood Prince Of Thieves - Romantic drama

Can't seem to make lists. Once in a while a film comes to mind and that's the one for now. Right now its 
"Strange Days" directed by Katheryn Bigelow (Hurt Locker) and written by then husband James Cameron (Avatar)
Next to Blade Runner its my fav SciFi with its noir mystery, gritty execution but most of all its SciFi concepts really f*&ked my mind.
Can't find a good copy around much less a small sized one.
How did you rate that film?
Only cause you say its good ;)

Thanks for this. Just watched it, and found it to be quite good.

But then I did some research, and it turns out that this is probably one of those cases in which the director's cut is worse than the original thatrical release: the director's cut is shorter by half an hour.

Unfortunately, the theatrical release hasn't been released on BluRay.

Will definitely download this. Thanks twentyforty.
I love that personal taste of yours.

@theaetetus : Theatrical Cut (1h58) - 18 minutes longer is available as Revenge 1990 1080i HDTV x264 DD2.0 but it's 6.68 GB and therefore not anyone's cup of tea. Also, quite a lot of people have great problems with playback of 1080p. I have this one, I watched both versions, but encoded one I have. Basically, both versions are equally good.

@theaetetus : ... and DC (this one) has spicier scenes inserted, TC is sanitized but have more sentimental ending (a little). Also, HDTV stream was technically incorrect and therefore not very suitable for ripping.

720 would be brilliant.... at least for me that is. 
Thx anyway whether u decide to up it or not.
Much appreciated
